page.title: 02GROWING VINES MAP REF.256232
page.content: Mr.& Mrs.R.Pratt bought{"Booker's {Vineyard"}in 1972.They first planted vines in 1973.Growing vines is called {"viticulture".}They also grew and sold vegetables.In 1980 they went over completely to vines though they have kept bees since 1975 and hope to get approx.160lb.of honey a year. In 1982 they bought 2 kids with the intention of eventually producing dairy products also.In{1983}they bought a further 2.5acres as grazing. They also had their{first commercial {wine crop}in 1983. The trade name for their wine is "Bolne", which is the old english name for Bolney. { "Bolne"}is a medium, dry, white wine. It costs Â£3.85 a bottle & Â£41 a case. The grapes are taken to Biddenden in Kent for vinification. The Pratts pick their own grapes and employ their own winemaker, who makes their wine.{Cont.
